articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Iran attack likely to increase pressure for US to leave Iraq
articles.description: Richard Engel, NBC News chief foreign correspondent, talks with Rachel Maddow about how Iranian missile strikes on bases in Iraq will likely make Iraqis more...

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Journalism crucial as Trump flirts with war without credibility
articles.description: Rachel Maddow laments that the Trump administration has so thoroughly squandered its credibility on past lies, including about why it picked this latest fight with Iran, that Americans who are trying to stay informed can only count on the efforts of quality j…

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Trump presents Americans with split screen of calamity
articles.description: Rachel Maddow remarks on the timing of Donald Trump's provocation of Iran and beginning of his impeachment trial in the Senate, and the challenge that poses to Americans having to track two harrowing stories at the same time.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Despite Trump's 'All is well!' tweet, situation with Iran remains very tense
articles.description: Veteran Middle East correspondent and Stanford Journalism Professor Janine Zacharia joins to discuss the precarious situation that remains between Trump and Iran after Tehran targeted U.S. forces in Iraq.

articles.title: Gen. Barry McCaffrey: Trump threats to Iran showed 'appalling' judgment
articles.description: Gen. Barry McCaffrey and our panel react to Trump's growing threats to Iran threatening cultural sites and more ahead of Iran's strikes against U.S. forces in Iraq.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Rep. Crow: Trump does not comprehend impact on troops
articles.description: Representative Jason Crow (D-CO), who has served in combat in Afghanistan and Iraq, says President Trump's tweet that "all is well" shows he does not understand or care about what troops and their families are experiencing as Iran targets two U.S. bases in Ir…
articles.content: Representative Jason Crow (D-CO), who has served in combat in Afghanistan and Iraq, says President Trump's tweet that "all is well" shows he does not understand or care about what troops and their families are experiencing as Iran targets two U.S. bases in Ir… [+14 chars]

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Wendy Sherman on the intent and impact of Trump’s tweet
articles.description: Former Amb. Wendy Sherman, lead negotiator on the Iran nuclear deal, analyzes the latest rhetoric of Donald Trump and Iran – and who it serves.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Sen. Amy Klobuchar: ‘All is not well’ with Iran, despite President Trump's tweet
articles.description: Senator Amy Klobuchar (D-Minn.) reacts to Iran's retaliatory airstrikes, telling Lawrence O'Donnell the Trump administration "had better have a strategy" moving forward.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: House Intel member Himes reacts to Iran strike
articles.description: Lawrence O’Donnell interviews Rep. Himes on Capitol Hill with his reaction to Iran’s strike on U.S. forces in Iraq.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Trump tweets 'All is well!' instead of addressing the nation after Iran strikes
articles.description: After hours of uncharacteristic silence, Trump tweeted 'All is well!' and 'So far, so good!' after U.S. forces were targeted by Iran while serving in Iraq.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Escalation between U.S. and Iran would threaten entire Middle East
articles.description: MSNBC's Ayman Mohyeldin, who has reported extensively from the Middle East, explains how escalating tensions between Iran and the U.S. could have a huge impact across the region.

articles.author: MPX
articles.title: Hardball 1/7/20
articles.description: Chris Matthews and a panel of guests discuss the political news of the day.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Andrea Mitchell: Trump has 'the worst national security team I've ever seen'
articles.description: Veteran NBC Chief Foreign Affairs Correspondent reacts to how the Trump team has handled escalating tensions with Iran.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: No immediate reports of U.S. casualties after Iran hits bases in Iraq
articles.description: There have been no reports of U.S. deaths after Iran fired over a dozen ballistic missiles at two Iraqi military bases where U.S. personnel are housed.

articles.author: MSNBC.com
articles.title: Day 1,083: Iran strikes back hitting Iraqi base housing U.S. forces
articles.description: After hitting an Iraqi base holding U.S. forces, Iran is telling the United States if it does not strike back there will be no further hostilities. The White House has not responded in the immediate aftermath.
